Class RouteProblem

  • java.lang.Object
    • RouteProblem
  • public class RouteProblem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a map with locations and roads between locations. the locations nad roads can be added by methods. The problem for which this class was created is to find the route between two valid locations through the roads.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addLocation​(Location location)
      Method for adding the a location in locations list
      void addRoad​(Road road)
      Method for adding the a road in roads list
      java.util.List<Location> findBestRoute​(Location startLocation, Location endLocation)
      This function return the exact route from end location to start location using the map which is returning from getBestRoutes function.
      java.util.Map<Location,​Location> getBestRoutes​(Location startLocation, Location endLocation)
      getBestRoute function determine the best route from start location to end location using the Dijkstra algorithm.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • addLocation

        public void addLocation​(Location location)
        Method for adding the a location in locations list
        Parameters:
        location - must not be in the existing list of locations

      • addRoad

        public void addRoad​(Road road)
        Method for adding the a road in roads list
        Parameters:
        road - must not be in the existing list of roads

      • getBestRoutes

        public java.util.Map<Location,​Location> getBestRoutes​(Location startLocation,
                                                            Location endLocation)
        getBestRoute function determine the best route from start location to end location using the Dijkstra algorithm.
        Parameters:
        startLocation - must by in locations list. It has the meaning of current/start location.
        endLocation - must by in locations list. The function determine if there is a road to endLocation.
        Returns:
        return true if exists a path between these 2 locations and false if does not exist.

      • findBestRoute

        public java.util.List<Location> findBestRoute​(Location startLocation,
                                              Location endLocation)
        This function return the exact route from end location to start location using the map which is returning from getBestRoutes function. The stack is to store the exact path from the mapping with all efficient routes from one node to another generated by the algorithm.
        Returns:
        the reverser stack which is converting to list of locations.
